title: Trump "Strongly" Requests Putin To Spare Lives Of Ukrainian Soldiers
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday there is a "very good chance" the war between Russia and Ukraine can end after productive discussions with President Vladimir Putin of Russia on Thursday.

title: 5 Injured As Man Attacks People With Iron Pipe At Golden Temple In Amritsar
content: Five people were injured when they were attacked by a man with rods at Amritsar's Golden Temple complex, the police said. The man was arrested and the situation was brought under control, news agency IANS reported.

title: On Camera, Drunk Driver Kills Woman In Vadodara, Screams "Another Round"
content: A road accident in the Karelibag area of Gujarat's Vadodara has left one dead and several others injured after an allegedly drunk driver crashed his car into multiple vehicles late on Thursday night.

title: Chennai Doctor Who Died By Suicide With Family Suffered Rs 5-Crore Loss
content: A doctor in Chennai, who died by suicide with his wife and their two teenage sons at their home on Thursday, had suffered financial losses amounting to Rs 5 crore.

title: Musk's Tesla Warns Trump Administration That Retaliatory Tariffs Could Harm It
content: In an unsigned letter to Jamieson Greer, the US trade representative, Tesla has said that although it "supports fair trade", the US administration should ensure that it did not "inadvertently harm US companies".

title: WhatsApp Message From 'Boss'? How Hyderabad Firm Nearly Lost Rs 1.95 Crore
content: A Hyderabad company was nearly tricked - via a WhatsApp message that seemed to come from the firm's Chairman and Managing Director - of nearly Rs 2 crore.

title: "A Green Card Holder Doesn't...": JD Vance Triggers New Immigration Debate
content: After US President Donald Trump's proposed 'gold card' initiative, which would create a new immigration pathway for wealthy foreigners, Vice President JD Vance's latest remarks on the rights of green card holders have triggered a fresh debate.

title: Rupee Symbol, Replaced By Tamil Nadu, Was Designed By A Tamilian
content: D Udaya Kumar, currently working as a professor at IIT Guwahati, designed the Indian rupee symbol in 2010.

title: Manipur YouTuber Who Challenged Anti-Terror Agency Tells Forces To "Go Back"
content: Sources said details of the YouTuber who identifies himself as Pt Marvin Kuki and runs a YouTube channel of the same name under the handle @PaotinmangChongloi have been flagged to the cyber cell.

title: Not Rohit Or Kohli, Ponting Says India Outstanding At CT "Because They..."
content: With three all-rounders starting in their playing XI in all five of their games at the recently concluded Champions Trophy, India flexed an incredible batting depth,

title: US Influencer Leaves Australia After Outrage Over Baby Wombat Video
content: In a now-deleted video, Sam Jones, an American influencer, was seen grabbing a baby wombat and carrying it away from his mother.

title: "As Soon As Train Stopped...": Hijacked Pak Train Driver Recalls Executions
content: Some hostages crouched on the floor for as long as 27 hours, remaining motionless, while some could only gasp in shock as armed rebels entered the train and began executing passengers.

title: Youth killed in Titagarh amidst Holi celebrations
content: The police arrested Pawan Rajbhar, who was earlier jailed over another criminal case in the area, in connection with the murder

title: SHRC project to combat drug, digital addiction among children in two coastal villages
content: Project will be implemented among children in the 10-18 age group in five select schools in Anchuthengu and Maryanad

title: Amid tight security, Holi celebrations, Friday prayers conducted peacefully across U.P.
content: The Holi celebrations, much like the Maha Kumbh, have silenced those claiming that Sanatana Dharma divides people, says U.P. CM

title: ‘Appu’ re-release: Theatres witness festive atmosphere as fans cheer for Puneeth Rajkumar
content: ‘Appu’, the 2002 Kannada film directed by Puri Jagannadh, launched Puneeth Rajkumar as a hero in the Kannada film industry. The movie was re-released as a part of the actor’s 50th birth anniversary celebrations

title: India adds six properties to tentative list for UNESCO recognition
content: The 'tentative list' is an inventory of properties each country intends to consider for UNESCO nomination

title: Opposition picks up on govt. using SCSP/TSP money on guarantees
content: BJP calls it ‘misuse’ while the Congress insists that it is a ‘false narrative’ being built by the saffron party

title: Cocoa farmers staring at a crisis in A.P. as price plummets
content: Current domestic market prices are much below last year’s rates, but even at the reduced prices there are no takers, say ryots; seek govt. intervention to stabilise prices

title: Nurse’s murder in Haveri takes communal colour with the arrest of her boyfriend
content: Niyaz Bennigere called Swati Byadgi to talk her out of marriage and with the help of his friends, strangled her to death before throwing the body into the Tungabhadra

title: Malankara Church discord widens further
content: Orthodox Syrian Church comes out against a call by Jacobite faction for coexistence like sister churches

title: Bail Plea Of Actor Ranya Rao, Arrested In Gold Smuggling Case, Rejected
content: A special court today denied bail to actor Ranya Rao, who was caught smuggling a large amount of gold. A second accused, Tarun Raju, has been sent to judicial custody for 15 days.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Former Congress MLA from Bilaspur shot at by unidentified people in Himachal Pradesh
content: Former MLA Bamber Thakur was sitting in the courtyard of the government accommodation allotted to his wife in Bilapsur along with others when four people came and opened fire

title: ED summons to Radhakrishnan signals resumption of ED-right wing media misinformation campaign against LDF: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) State Secretary M V Govindan says the agency has again borrowed a page from its tried and tested fake news playbook in a desperate bid to sway public opinion against the second Pinarayi Vijayan government in the politically sensitive run-up to the local body polls and the Assembly elections in 2026

title: Pemmasani and Lokesh participate in Mangalagiri temple ‘rathotsavam’
content: The streets of Mangalagiri turned into a sea of devotees as thousands flocked to witness the grand spectacle

title: Five injured in clash in Punjab’s Golden Temple premises, one serious
content: “There was a clash inside the Golden Temple premises, and people of both sides suffered injuries. The workers of SGPC have also been injured. Action will be taken according to law”, said police

title: Punjab: Shiv Sena leader shot dead, minor boy suffers bullet injuries
content: While police said the incident could be a fallout of a personal rivalry, the deceased's family said he did not have enmity with anyone

title: The manifold perils of stretching body out through sunroof
content: ”Many overlook the danger of standing through a sunroof, risking serious injury if brakes are suddenly applied”

title: State govt. must take responsibility for demolition of Kasinayana Jyothi Kshetram, says YSRCP leader
content: Malladi Vishnu accuses the ruling TDP government of playing politics with the Hindu sentiments while failing to provide genuine protection to religious sites

title: Real money gaming firms track offshore betting growth with alarm
content: Real money gaming firms have argued that heavy taxation would lead to the proliferation of illegal offshore apps; with those fears now materialising, financial strain is leading to industry consolidation

title: Joy and fervour mark Holi celebrations in most North Karnataka towns, villages
content: In Belagavi, men and boys gather at Bhadkal Galli and enjoy rain dances and a musical performance by local musicians

title: None of the 1,275 gazetted posts filled in Ladakh in the past six years, govt. informs parliamentary panel
content: Of 3,596 vacancies in non-gazetted posts in the Union Territory, 3,172 have been filled through various agencies; a staff selection board has also been formed, Home Ministry tells a House panel

title: KTU Syndicate meet called off due to lack of quorum
content: The meeting assumed relevance as it came two months after the previous one ended in chaos with the Vice-Chancellor walking out midway

title: Three tribal children found in makeshift hut in Idukki moved to care home
content: The children, including a 12-year-old girl and two boys aged seven and six, lived there with their father.

title: A card that helps students be fit, healthy, and perform better in examinations
content: The Bhavita card issued to students of high schools in Parvatipuram-Manyam district contains their health status, which is enabling the administration take remedial measures wherever needed

title: Two die in hospital, families say it is because of medical negligence
content: The patients suffering from TB breath their last at the District Hospital on the premises of Gulbarga Institute of Medical Sciences

title: Smart summer strategies vital for sustaining milk production, says expert
content: Proper ventilation in cattle sheds, high-quality feed with fibre content, access to quality drinking water, and installing cooling mechanisms will ensure cattle’s health and improve yield, says T.P. Sethumadhavan, former director, KVASU

title: NSS to organise special campaign against drug abuse in Kerala
content: NSS units will organise awareness sessions at 1,000 centres in the State as part of the Life is Beautiful campaign, says Bindu

title: Kochi Corporation to set up permanent adalat offering free legal service to public
content: The main office of the Corporation and its six zonal offices would be part of the adalat being set up in coordination with the Kerala State Legal Services Authority and the District Legal Services Authority (DLSA)

title: Meghalaya university chancellor remanded in judicial custody
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma has had run-ins with Mahbubul Hoque. While Mr. Hoque has been booked in six cases in all, the Gauhati High Court granted him bail in the present case and protected him from arrest in some of the previous cases.

title: Justice Atul Sreedharan transferred from J&K to M.P. High Court
content: Justice Sreedharan had requested a transfer in early 2023 to avoid conflict of interest as his daughter began legal practice before the District Court and the Indore Bench of the High Court.

title: Ration committee report trigger backlash; ration dealers’ reject recommendations
content: The panel recommends the closure of nearly 4,000 ration outlets as a means to increase dealers’ commissions. It calls for ensuring that each shop serves at least 800 ration cardholders and merging of multiple outlets operated by the same licensees.

title: Mercury rising in North Karnataka districts with 56 locations breaching 40 degrees C
content: Kallur Hobli in Raichur district records the highest maximum temperature of 42.4 degrees Celsius in the State

title: Watch: Afghanistan abandoned: How should India engage Taliban?
content: As India essays closer ties with the Taliban, and with the US freezing funds, have Afghanistan’s exiles and women just been abandoned?

title: UV index touches 10 in Kollam, alert issued
content: While a UV index of 6 to 7 indicates a need for precautions, 8 to 10 requires extreme vigilance, and above 11 is considered high risk

title: Registration for Agniveers’ recruitment begins in Guntur
content: The process for 2025-26 for candidates from 13 districts of Andhra Pradesh can be initiated through www.joinindianarmy.nic.in, and the last date is April 10

title: High-level meet chalks out Thrissur Pooram plans
content: Pooram will be conducted in all its grandeur with ample focus on safety, says Devaswom Minister V.N. Vasavan

title: North Karnataka gets its first Sleep Centre
content: Throwing focus on creating awareness on sleep deprivation and related health disorders, the centre celebrates World Sleep Day with a walkathon

title: 116 new tourist destinations sanctioned across the country
content: The Tourism Ministry will also conduct job oriented short term skill programmes through various institutes across the country

title: Land Rights Act amendment aims to expedite appeal process
content: It seeks to shift the appellate authority from the District Revenue Officer to the Sub-Collector/Revenue Divisional Officer

title: Lokesh promises to address issues concerning Mangalagiri constituency
content: Distribution of housing plots, dedicated cow shelters, and steps to ease traffic congestion are among the initiatives in the pipeline, he says

title: After Attukal Pongala, 345 tonnes of waste generated in Thiruvananthapuram
content: While the segregated plastic waste was taken to the material collection facilities, biodegradable waste had to be taken to dumping sites as the quantity was much more than the decentralised facilities like aerobic bins could handle

title: Passenger buses vandalised in Maharashtra
content: Police say it is not related to the language issue but a case of Holi revellers throwing bottles at the vehicles

title: Forest officials suspect leopard killed woman near Ooty
content: The officials say there were pug marks at the scene where the partially eaten body of a 50-year-old woman was found on March 13

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: Lawrence Super Bowl jab sparks spat with Parsons
content: DeMarcus Lawrence told a Seattle blogger that he was "not going to win a Super Bowl" in Dallas, a comment that led Cowboys star Micah Parsons to respond: "This what rejection and envy look like! This some clown s---!"

title: Texas' potential bid adds to 'historic' SEC season
content: Texas, the No. 13 seed in the SEC tournament and on the bubble for the NCAA tournament, beat Texas A&M in double overtime to reach the quarterfinals.

title: Star Texas golfer apologizes after heckling Rory
content: University of Texas golfer Luke Potter has apologized after he reportedly was removed from the grounds at TPC Sawgrass earlier this week for heckling star golfer Rory McIlroy.

title: Golden Knights sign G Hill to 6-year, $37.5M deal
content: The Golden Knights have signed goaltender Adin Hill to a six-year contract extension through the 2030-31 season, a deal that averages $6.25 million per year.

title: Former reality TV star wins longest-ever Iditarod
content: Jessie Holmes, a former reality television star on "Life Below Zero," is the winner of the longest-ever Iditarod Trail Sled Dog Race.

title: Curry hits 4,000 3s: 'Beyond my wildest dreams'
content: Stephen Curry became the first player to reach 4,000 career 3-pointers, extending his record to the milestone number during a win over the Kings.

title: Sources: George, doctors mulling star's injuries
content: 76ers forward Paul George is consulting with doctors this week on treatment options for his groin and knee injuries, including a possible procedure, sources told ESPN.

title: Men's Bracketology: UNC's win pushes Xavier and Indiana to the brink
content: Indiana drops down to take the "second team out" spot as North Carolina bumps up after a win over Wake Forest on Thursday.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: 'You don't hang banners for milestones': Tom Izzo adapts and takes aim at another title
content: Izzo is surpassing milestones and reached a big anniversary of his lone title. At 70, with a highly ranked team, he's hoping to add to his legacy.

title: Cooper Flagg injury impact: Duke isn't 'Final Four good' without him, more reactions
content: How could Flagg's and Maliq Brown's potential absences impact the Blue Devils on the court -- and on Selection Sunday?

title: Women's Bracketology: Stephen F. Austin seals spot, but all eyes on Ivy Madness
content: With the final two teams in the field facing off Friday, the center of the Bracketology universe is Providence, Rhode Island.

title: Inside the Sabres' never-ending rebuild -- and how they get back to the playoffs
content: From Ryan O'Reilly to Jack Eichel to Sam Reinhart and more, success follows for a player once he leaves, with Buffalo set to miss the playoffs again.

title: Rashford, MLS in Tuchel's first England squad
content: Thomas Tuchel has handed Marcus Rashford a shock recall in his first England squad, which also includes call-ups for Myles Lewis-Skelly, Dominic Solanke and Dan Burn.

title: Bruno hits back at Ratcliffe's 'overpaid' comments
content: Bruno Fernandes has hit back at Sir Jim Ratcliffe's suggestion that some Manchester United players are overpaid by telling the British billionaire "the club agrees to do the contracts."

title: Prince William: PL 3 p.m blackout is 'irritating'
content: Prince William has said he finds the 3 p.m blackout rule "irritating" and is a hindrance to his Aston Villa fandom.

title: Alexander-Arnold to miss Carabao Cup final
content: Liverpool defender Trent Alexander-Arnold is set to miss this weekend's Carabao Cup final against Newcastle United through injury.

title: Super Cup probe: Judge questions Gerard Piqué
content: Former Barcelona defender Gerard Piqué was questioned by a judge on Friday as part of judicial probe into the business deal that led to the Spanish Super Cup being hosted in Saudi Arabia.

title: Real Madrid's Asencio earns first Spain call-up
content: Spain coach Luis de la Fuente has included Real Madrid defender Raúl Asencio in the squad for the first time for the Nations League quarterfinal tie against the Netherlands in a squad that also includes Barcelona forward Lamine Yamal.

title: Messi scores on return as Miami wins in Jamaica
content: Lionel Messi scored on his return to action as Inter Miami triumphed 2-0 in Jamaica over Cavalier FC on Thursday to qualify for the quarterfinals of the Concacaf Champions Cup.

title: Eddie Howe: 'Chance to make history' in cup final
content: Eddie Howe has said Newcastle United have the chance to make history by beating Liverpool in the Carabao Cup final on Sunday.

title: 75 years of innovation: How F1 has evolved since 1950 and where it's headed
content: To celebrate F1's 75th anniversary, ESPN charts the sport's evolution since 1950 through its most iconic cars, and details where it's headed in 2026.

title: If Hamilton is in F1 title fight, Leclerc expects to be, too
content: Lewis Hamilton's move to Ferrari has dominated headlines, but teammate Charles Leclerc is ready for a big year.

title: Dick Vitale hands out the only postseason awards that matter
content: With Cooper Flagg mentions galore, here are the best players of the 2024-25 men's college hoops season, according to Dick Vitale.

title: Watkins, Bueckers, Hidalgo headline All-America team -- but who's player of the year?
content: Our experts name their women's college basketball player of the year, All-Americans and biggest surprise.

title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando Pride repeat as champions?
content: With the National Women's Soccer League returning to action this weekend, we take a look at where the 14 clubs stands and how close each is to winning the NWSL championship.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea beat Man United to Quenda deal
content: Chelsea have agreed a deal to sign Sporting CP wing-back Geovany Quenda from under the noses of Man United. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Every way to bet on Alex Ovechkin's goals record chase
content: Alex Ovechkin is one of the hottest NHL bets, here are the special markets bettors can bet on as he closes in on the goals scored record.

title: Betting buzz: Steelers attract second-most Super Bowl bets this week
content: Bettors were on the Pittsburgh Steelers' Super Bowl odds after the acquisition of wide receiver DK Metcalf

title: Can Saskatchewan clinch a playoff spot? What to watch in NLL Week 16 and beyond
content: Get caught up on all the key intel before the games on the docket this weekend, all available to stream on ESPN+.

title: Jason Sudeikis confirms 'Ted Lasso' Season 4, teases new team
content: Sudeikis said on the "New Heights" podcast that Lasso would be coaching a women's team in the new season.

title: Free passage for local people within 10 km radius at Panniyankara toll plaza
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Trump tariffs impact: Is a US recession likely and does India need to worry about it?
content: Donald Trump's tariff moves have taken the world by storm - the US economy too is staring at uncertainty as the impact of high tariffs on countries around the world is unknown. Economists have expressed concern of a likely US recession like scenario. In such a case, should India be worried? We take a look:

title: Four teenage boys drown in river after Holi celebrations in Thane
content: Four teenage boys, students of Class X, drowned in the Ulhas river in Thane's Badlapur area after Holi celebrations on Friday. They were swept away by the sudden rise in the water level. The victims have been identified, and their bodies have been recovered and sent for post-mortem. An investigation is underway.

title: Silent retreat, loud speculations: Is Kejriwal gearing up for Punjab polls?
content: Arvind Kejriwal’s Vipassana retreat in Punjab may signal a strategic shift for AAP, potentially involving party reshuffles ahead of the 2027 Punjab Assembly elections. While some speculate on internal meetings, AAP dismisses these as opposition rumors without substantiated development agendas.

title: Elon Musk claims Soros, Hoffman fund Tesla protests; Fortnite CEO agrees
content: Epic Games CEO Tim Sweeney supports Elon Musk's claims that protests against Tesla are funded by billionaire donors, connecting it to Epic's battle with Big Tech. Sweeney criticizes deceptive funding of anti-Tesla campaigns and their violent fringes. Protests have intensified globally, reflecting dissatisfaction with Musk's political engagements, leading to notable incidents and public displays of disapproval.

title: 75+ Holi messages, greetings, wishes, and quotes
content: Holi 2025, the festival of colors, marks the arrival of spring and the triumph of good over evil. People globally exchange heartfelt messages, wishes, and greetings, spreading happiness and positivity among friends, family, and loved ones. Celebrate the spirit of togetherness with joy and vibrant colors.

title: Attack at Golden Temple: Man wielding iron rod injures 5 devotees
content: In a violent attack at the Golden Temple, Amritsar, five individuals were assaulted by a man wielding an iron rod during the New Nanakshahi Year celebrations. The assailant, identified as Julfan from Haryana, seriously injured two victims. He was apprehended with the help of CCTV footage and handed over to the police.

title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, Infosys co-founder, addressed the hype around AI in India, criticizing many marketed systems as traditional programming. He emphasized the significance of machine learning and deep learning for true AI, predicting incremental human-like capabilities. Despite anticipating job losses, Murthy highlighted AI's potential for economic growth and urged entrepreneurs to create employment opportunities to tackle poverty.

title: New twist in Sudiksha Konanki disappearance case
content: Joshua Riibe, the man who was last seen with Sudiksha Konanki, claims he rescued Sudiksha Konaki from rough Caribbean waters but cannot explain her subsequent disappearance. Riibe told police he fell asleep after vomiting seawater and did not see her again. Police are investigating potential foul play, and Riibe has declined to answer further questions on his lawyer's advice.

title: Honeytrapped: Ordnance factory worker held for leaking secrets to Pak's ISI
content: An Ordnance Factory employee, Ravindra Kumar, was arrested by the Uttar Pradesh ATS for allegedly leaking classified defense information to a Pakistani intelligence handler posing as Neha Sharma. He shared sensitive documents via WhatsApp, endangering national security. Authorities continue to investigate the extent of the security breach.

title: Elon Musk resharing post saying 'Hitler didn’t murder millions, ...' sparks controversy
content: Elon Musk stirred controversy by sharing a post suggesting mass killings under Hitler, Stalin, and Mao were carried out by public sector workers, not the dictators themselves. The post has been criticized, with Lee Saunders, AFSCME president, condemning the implication. This follows Musk's previous backlash over a gesture resembling a Nazi salute at Trump's second inauguration.

title: 'Because of Donald Trump': Portugal rules out buying F-35s from US
content: Portugal won't buy Lockheed Martin F-35s from the United States though the country's air force gave a go-ahead for that. The country now wants to take into account other situational aspects and President Donald Trump is one of them. Citing Portuguese media Publico, Politico reported that outgoing defence minister Nuno Melo shot down the proposal of buying F-35s from the US because of Donald Trump.

title: Narayana Murthy warns against the rise of AI
content: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy addressed the growing AI trend in India, cautioning against overhyping 'ordinary' programs as AI. He explained the principles of machine learning and deep learning and emphasized their potential. While acknowledging job displacement, he highlighted AI's opportunities in creating new professions, particularly in autonomous vehicles and other sectors.

title: Blast at Pakistan mosque, Islamist leader among 4 hurt
content: A bomb explosion during Friday prayers at a South Waziristan mosque injured four, including JUI district chief Maulana Abdullah Nadeem. The blast occurred at Maulana Abdul Aziz Mosque, with an IED planted in the pulpit. Security officials are investigating the site, with no group claiming responsibility yet. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa mosques have been frequently targeted during Friday prayers.

title: 'Can field 2-3 teams at same time': DK credits IPL for revolutionising Indian cricket
content: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik has credited the IPL with transforming Indian cricket by fostering a winning mentality and improving infrastructure. Karthik emphasised the depth of talent in Indian cricket, allowing the country to field multiple competitive teams simultaneously. He highlighted the confidence-building experiences IPL provides by allowing players to compete alongside global legends.

title: 'Another round', screams drunk driver after killing woman in car rampage
content: A 23-year-old law student, Rakshit Chaurasia, allegedly in a drunken state, hit three vehicles, injuring eight and killing one in Vadodara. Chaurasia was driving while his friend Meet Chauhan owned the car. Chaurasia and Chauhan face charges, including culpable homicide. The deceased woman is identified as Hemali Patel, with her husband critically injured.

title: Pocso case: K'taka HC stays summons against Yediyurappa
content: The Karnataka High Court stayed the trial court's decision to take cognizance of charges against former Chief Minister B.S. Yediyurappa and three others in a Pocso Act case. The stay, pending further hearings, exempts them from personal appearances following an appeal that questioned the complaint's validity.

title: Who is Gauri Spratt: Aamir Khan introduces his Bengaluru-based girlfriend
content: Aamir Khan introduced his girlfriend, Gauri Spratt, at a pre-birthday event in Mumbai. They have been dating for over a year and decided to make their relationship public. Gauri hails from Bengaluru and manages a salon in Mumbai. She has been involved in Aamir's professional life and met his family and friends.

title: When Will the Los Angeles Lakers Star Return After Groin Injury?
content: LeBron James suffered a groin injury during the Los Angeles Lakers vs. Boston Celtics game and will miss 1-2 weeks. He is optimistic about his recovery and will take proper measures to heal. Luka Doncic will lead the team in his absence as the Lakers aim to secure a strong playoff position.

title: From daredevils to 'anti-nationals': Forest watchers face UAPA charges
content: Two forest watchers at Kanha National Park in Madhya Pradesh have been arrested under UAPA for allegedly aiding Maoists. Their detention has caused unrest among forest staff, leading to fears of being caught between insurgents and law enforcement. The arrests raise concerns about the infiltration of insurgents within wildlife sanctuaries, impacting both security and conservation efforts.

title: 'Mistook us for dead': Pakistan train driver recalls 36-hour terror siege
content: The driver of Jaffar Express recounted the terror when BLA militants attacked the train, killing 21 civilians and 4 soldiers. The militants exploded a bomb under the engine, causing a derailment. The Pakistani military rescued 340 passengers after a two-day standoff, claiming 33 attackers were killed. The BLA disputed this, alleging they still hold hostages.

title: 'Boo me, but don't boo the team': David Warner
content: David Warner, set to debut in The Hundred with London Spirit, remains unfazed by potential boos from English fans. He relishes the challenge and excitement such reception brings. Though retired from international cricket, Warner remains critical of 'Bazball,' questioning its effectiveness in Australian conditions. Warner has often encountered a hostile reception in England, with tensions reaching a peak during the 2023 Ashes at Lord’s following Jonny Bairstow’s controversial stumping.

title: Metro expansions, new airport: Key takeaways from Tamil Nadu Budget
content: The Tamil Nadu government presented the 2025-26 budget with key welfare initiatives, including fare-free bus travel for women and monthly financial support. Amid the budget session, AIADMK protested over corruption allegations. Significant funds were allocated for housing, education, and new infrastructure projects.

title: Captain meets Captain! Harmanpreet, Hardik share MI's winning vibe - Watch
content: Mumbai Indians reached their second Women's Premier League final by defeating Gujarat Giants by 47 runs. The celebration featured both captains, Harmanpreet Kaur and Hardik Pandya, sharing a joyful moment. The win included standout performances from Nat Sciver-Brunt and Hayley Matthews. Mumbai Indians will now face Delhi Capitals in the title match.

title: Sana Khan slams trolls attacking her son and husband
content: Sana Khan has received hateful comments on social media about herself and her family, including her son. She addressed these trolls, criticizing the lack of education and civility in such remarks. Additionally, Sana faced backlash after a viral video showed her questioning Sambhavna Seth's attire, which was seen as imposing religious beliefs.

title: Day after wedding, woman strangled to death by family for marrying man she loved
content: A woman named Neha in Greater Noida was allegedly strangled to death by her father and brother for marrying someone from a different caste. They cremated her body swiftly. Neha's husband, Suraj, alerted the police after learning about her death. The father and brother were arrested following the confession. An FIR has been registered for murder.

title: 'Shami is a world-class player for a reason': Young Aussie rookie in awe of India pacer
content: Australia’s young all-rounder, Cooper Connolly, had a memorable ICC Champions Trophy semi-final debut against India. Despite an early dismissal by Mohammed Shami and dropping a catch, Connolly took Rohit Sharma's wicket, marking a significant achievement. Reflecting on the experience, he remains optimistic and eager to seize more opportunities at the international level.

title: Class 5 student guarding crop with dad mistaken for thief, shot dead
content: In Babupur village, UP's Shahjahanpur, a class 5 student was fatally shot by a villager, Veerpal, and his son, Akash, after they mistook him for a thief while he was guarding his family's crop field. The incident occurred as the boy delivered dinner to his father. Both accused have been arrested and charged with murder.

title: The inside story of two Australian woman kissing an Indian journalist on live TV
content: In 2015, journalist Vimal Kumar became part of an unexpected viral moment when two Australian women kissed him live on TV during a broadcast. Orchestrated by his photographer, the prank video has remained a popular clip on the internet. Kumar, a veteran sports reporter, continues to share insights through his YouTube channel.

title: Celebrities arrive at Ayan Mukerji’s home to pay their last respects to Deb Mukherjee
content: Veteran actor Deb Mukherjee passed away at 83 on March 14, 2025. Bollywood celebrities including Kajol, Jaya Bachchan, Ranbir Kapoor, and Alia Bhatt visited the Mukerji residence to offer their condolences. His funeral will be held at Pawan Hans Crematorium in Juhu. Mukherjee was known for his roles in 'Abhinetri' and 'Ek Baar Muskurado.'

title: 'Distilleries siphoned off funds’: ED claims Rs 1,000cr booze scam in Tamil Nadu
content: Distilleries in Tamil Nadu allegedly siphoned off Rs 1,000 crore in collaboration with bottle-making companies through inflated expenses and bogus purchases, as revealed by ED. The funds were paid to Tasmac officials as kickbacks to secure more supply orders and manipulate tenders, leading to high profits.

title: Man paraded naked, beaten up over affair in Gujarat
content: In Sabarkantha district, a man was abducted, beaten, and paraded naked by the husband and relatives of a woman he allegedly had an affair with. The incident occurred on March 11 in Chadasana village. The police have arrested seven people. The victim was forced to apologize in writing and his mobile was stolen.

title: Great-granddaughter of Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar is alive
content: Sultana Begum, the great-granddaughter-in-law of the last Mughal emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar, lives in a Kolkata slum in stark contrast to her royal heritage. She faces financial hardships, surviving on a meager pension, with little government support. Human rights activists have highlighted her plight, indicative of the neglect experienced by descendants of India's former aristocracy.

title: 'My identity was erased': How Telangana man ended up in Myanmar cybercrime den
content: Telangana police, led by the Cyber Security Bureau, have registered nine FIRs against agents involved in trafficking individuals into Myanmar's cybercrime hubs. The crackdown follows the return of 24 victims and focuses on deceptive recruitment and coercion tactics used via social media. Further cases and identifications are underway.

title: 'There was no doubt': Australia spinner after clearing bowling action test
content: Australian spinner Matthew Kuhnemann has been cleared to bowl after his action was questioned post-Sri Lanka tour. His 16-wicket haul led Australia to a 2-0 win. Kuhnemann was confident about his action and his experience. Despite missing one domestic game, he used the break to recover. Now, he's eyeing a spot on the West Indies tour.

title: POCSO case: Karnataka HC grants interim relief to former CM BS Yediyurappa
content: Karnataka High Court granted B.S. Yediyurappa interim relief by staying the summons in a POCSO Act case, requiring his appearance on March 15. The court emphasized a comprehensive investigation and quashing the charge sheet. Yediyurappa faces allegations of inappropriate touching and harassment but denies all charges, citing political motivations and readiness to face legal proceedings.

title: Watch: Video of New Zealand PM Christopher Luxon playing holi goes viral
content: A video of New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon celebrating Holi at ISKCON Auckland has resurfaced online. Luxon, set to visit India from March 16-20, aims to enhance trade and investment ties. He will meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, President Droupadi Murmu, and other leaders, emphasizing his admiration for India.

title: 'We'll see some get deported': What US VP said about green card holders
content: US Vice President JD Vance addressed key issues including the deportation of green card holders, immigration enforcement, and border security on 'The Ingraham Angle.' He discussed the administration's efforts to reduce illegal migration, strengthen the economy, and implement 'America first' trade policies. Vance also highlighted the administration's commitment to tackling national security threats posed by non-citizens.

title: Ranya Rao gold smuggling case: Accused Tarun Raju sent to 15-day judicial custody
content: Kannada actress Ranya Rao was arrested for allegedly smuggling over 14 kg of gold after traveling to Dubai four times within 15 days. Her associate, Tarun Raju, was remanded to 15 days of judicial custody for his role in facilitating the purchase of the gold.

content: free-to-play edition of the game is available on all platforms aside from Switch . kick off, Club Rush, and Learn To Play will be available as game modes featuring teams from Germany's Bundesliga and Frauen-Bundesliga . this first rotation will end on Apr. 2.

title: Power Rankings: Capitals back at No. 1, plus each team's playoff scoring leaders
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday, which generates our master list . the top career playoff scorers for each of the league's teams are ranked by the NHL's official records site .

title: Liverpool's Slot looks to follow Klopp, Newcastle chase history
content: arne slot's side are 15 points clear at the top of the table with nine games left to play . the reds are closing on what would be only a second league title since 1990 . a penalty shootout win over liverpool puts the club 15 points ahead of the quarterfinals .

title: After PSG beat Liverpool, we ask: Is Dembélé the world's best?
content: ale Moreno says the departure of Kylian Mbappe has enabled Luis Enrique to turn PSG into a stronger team overall . he was an 18-year-old playing for Rennes and was on his way to scoring 12 goals and assisting five more in fewer than 2,000 minutes . "you also score with your right foot?" he asked .

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: the two-time pro bowler revealed he's engaged to R&B star Normani . the couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by singer Ciara . he joined fifth Harmony, a girl group formed from solo contestants .

title: No 'trust the process'? What's next for the Phoenix Suns
content: Kevin Durant helps the Suns erase a 23-point deficit en route to defeating the Clippers . the suns had given up 41 points in the second quarter and trailed by 19 entering the fourth . Durant later downplayed his first-quarter sideline clash with coach Mike Budenholzer .

title: Veteran wide receiver Patrick re-signs with Lions
content: the Detroit Lions have re-signed veteran wide receiver Tim Patrick . the 31-year-old was able to find a role within the Lions' high-powered offense last season . he was signed to the practice squad in august before being signed on the active roster .

title: ‘He was getting buckets’: Cooper Flagg always seemed inevitable
content: Cooper Flagg suffered a left ankle injury late in the first half of Duke's ACC Tournament quarterfinal game against Georgia Tech . the flag is pinned to the siding above the front door of Nemer's home alongside Sebasticook Lake . his facebook page is a shrine to Flagg, an endless scroll of highlights, stats and overt gushing that might seem like hyperbole if directed at anyone other than college basketball's biggest star .

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: More Humiliation For Pak Cricketers: All 50 Go Unsold In The Hundred Draft
content: all 50 players - 45 men and 5 women - went unsold in The Hundred draft . Naseem Shah was the highest-priced among them . noor Ahmad and new Zealand all-rounder Michael Bracewell got the best deals .
